intro: Petitia oleina, commonly known as the golden buttercup, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, while its flowers consist of numerous stamens surrounding a central pistil. Petitia oleina is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
